Container.Name: bw-export
Container.Overview:
Bitwarden Export to Backup
Bash docker image that exports your Bitwarden vault contents Features
This simple bash docker image uses the Bitwarden CLI to perform three backup tasks:
export personal vault export organization vault (if applicable) export file attachments (if applicable)
The docker image provides the choice of creating unencrypted export files or password-encrypted export files. Attachments are not encrypted.

Config.Name: BW_URL_SERVER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: If you have your own Bitwarden or Vaulwarden server, set in the environment variable BW_URL_SERVER its url address.

Config.Name: BW_CLIENTID
Config.Description: Your Bitwarden Personal API Key can be obtain in: https://bitwarden.com/help/personal-api-key/

Config.Name: BW_CLIENTSECRET
Config.Description: Your Bitwarden Personal API Key can be obtain in: https://bitwarden.com/help/personal-api-key/

Config.Name: BW_ORGANIZATIONS_LIST
Config.Description:
OPTIONAL: Set one or more organizations separated by comma. To obtain your organization_id value, open a terminal and type:bw login #(follow the prompts); bw list organizations | jq -r '.[0] | .id'
Example: cada13d7-5418-37ed-981b-be822121c593,cada13d7-5418-37ed-981b-be82219879878979,cada13d7-5418-37ed-981b-be822121c5435
If empty, the container export a backup of ALL Organizations in vault

Config.Name: EXPORT_PASSWORD
Config.Description: The password used to encrypt the exporte vault.
